Directors, in whole at any time or in part from time to time, on or after December 31,
1977, upon tho notice hercinafter provided for in Section 4, by the payment therefor u
cash of $100 per share (herein called the "redemption price") plus an amount equal tr
the neerued and unpaid cumulative dividends thereon to the date fixed by the Board of
Disectors as the redemption date. If at any time less thnn all Preferred Stock then out-
standing shall be called for redemption, the shares so called for redemption shall be
sclected by lot or pro rata as the Board of Directors by resolution may determine, subject
lo any limitations contained herein. The Corporation may also, from time to time, purchase
or otherwise acquire Preferred Stock theretofore issued and at the time outstanding at a
price not in excess of the redemption price.
The foregoing prragraph is subject to the provision that, in the event that any
quarterly dividend due on or any purchase obligation pursuant to Section 5 with respect
to Preferred Stock shall be in default (whether or not there thall be funds legally avail-
lon slihat Corporahed, turen ce beve haslt slulhafa sh delucl alind untfor), arehe tebla
not redeem nny Preferred Stock or any parity shares, as hereinafter defined in this

ously by the Corporation or such subsidiary to all holders of record of Preferred Stock and
any parity shares providing for the purchase thereof at a stated price or prices which will
result in equal treatment among the Prefered Stock and such parity shures on a basis
proportionate to the respective redemption prices of the Preferred Stock and such parity
shares and upon stated terms, other than price, which shall be the same with respect to
Preferred Stock and all parity shares.
"Parity shares" as used herein shall mean shares ranking on a parity with the Pre-
feired Stock with respect to the payment of dividends and the distribution of assets upon
